The patient was on mechanical ventilation with a set tidal volume of 400 mL, positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) of 10 cmH2O, fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) of 30%, and a respiratory system compliance (RSBI) deferred due to hemodynamic instability and an unstable airway. Assessment and plan include respiratory failure, chronic, and HIV (acquired immunodeficiency syndrome). The patient is receiving ICU care, including nutrition, glycemic control, arterial line monitoring, prophylaxis for deep vein thrombosis (DVT), stress ulcer, and ventilator-associated pneumonia (VAP).
